name: Waffled Falafel
author: The Gruntled Gourmand
summary: A delicious twist on a classic! Keep cooked waffles warm in a low oven. Serve with hummus, tomatoes, cucumbers, and parsley.
ingredients: 2 (15 ounce) cans garbanzo beans (chickpeas), drained and rinsed
3 cloves roasted garlic, or more to taste
directions: Preheat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions
Spray inside of waffle iron with cooking spray
Process garbanzo beans in a food processor until coarsely chopped
Add onion, egg whites, cilantro, parsley, garlic, flour, cumin, salt, coriander, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and cardamom to garbanzo beans
Pulse, scraping down the sides of the bowl occasionally, until falafel batter resembles a coarse meal
Pour batter into a bowl and stir with a fork
Spoon about 1/4 cup falafel batter onto each section of the preheated waffle iron
Cook until evenly browned, about 5 minutes
